title: Past Or Present Perfect Tense Exercise

questions.question: He .................. all his childhood in a quaint village in China.
questions.description: We use the simple past tense to talk about finished longer situations in the past.

questions.question: I ...................... all day yesterday.
questions.description: We use the past continuous tense to stress that an activity was in progress at every moment during a period of time.

questions.question: Mozart died while he ..................... the Requiem.
questions.description: The past continuous is often used with the simple past tense. In this case, the past continuous usually refers to a longer background action.

questions.question: I ..................... the cleaning. What shall I do now?
questions.description: We use perfect tenses to indicate completion.

questions.question: I ................... in India for ten years when I was a child.
questions.description: We use the simple past to talk about longer situations in the past.

questions.question: I canâ€™t play tomorrow because I ................. my leg.
questions.description: We use the present perfect tense to say that a finished action is connected with the present in some way.

questions.question: My puppy ....................
questions.description: My puppy is dead now. We use the present perfect tense to say that a finished action is connected with the present in some way.

questions.question: I ................... a lot in Asia and Africa.
questions.description: The present perfect tense is often used to express the idea of completion or achievement.

questions.question: Once upon a time there .................... a beautiful princess.
questions.description: The present perfect tense is not used in story-telling.

questions.question: He .................... hard for years.
questions.description: The present perfect is commonly used with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: ....................... Romeo and Juliet on TV last night?
questions.description: We cannot use the present perfect tense with time expressions referring to the past.

questions.question: My late grandfather ................. a lot for me.
questions.description: We do not use the present perfect when we are thinking of a particular finished time, even if we do not mention it. Grandfather is no longer alive, so obviously the reference is to the past.
